titulo: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
resumo: The story follows the misadventures of the last surviving human, Arthur Dent, and his alien friend, Ford Prefect, as they travel through space and time.
The story takes place during three years of the Great Depression in the fictional Maycomb, Alabama.
The novel details two days in the life of 16-year-old Holden Caulfield after he has been expelled from prep school.
The novel is set in a dystopian future where critical thought is suppressed by a totalitarian regime.
The novel chronicles the events of 1922 in the fictional Long Island village of West Egg.
The novel follows the story of Elizabeth Bennet and her four sisters as they navigate social class, love, and marriage in Georgian-era England.
The novel follows seven generations of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo, Colombia, and explores themes of history, memory, and solitude.
The novel tells the story of hobbit Frodo Baggins as he embarks on a quest to destroy the One Ring, anancient artifact created by the dark lord Sauron.
The novel takes place in a dystopian future where the Capitol selects a boy and a girl from each of the twelve districts to fight to the death in the annual Hunger Games.

titulo: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
resumo: The novel follows the life of young orphan Harry Potter who discovers on his eleventh birthday that he is a wizard.
The novel follows symbologist Robert Langdon and cryptologist Sophie Neveu as they investigate a murder in the Louvre Museum in Paris and discover a conspiracy involving the Holy Grail.
